description: Single storey rear/side extension; rear roof extension to main roofslope incorporating a Juliet balcony; rear roof extension to rear outrigger roof slope incorporating two side facing windows; installation of three rooflights to front roof slope; replacement of glass roof to rear conservatory (following demolition of part-conservatory and existing rear/side wall)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be retained in accordance with drawing title number(s): 101 001 Location & Block Plans 101 002 Site Plan, 101 001 Ground Floor Plans, 101 002 Basement & First Floor Plans, 101 003 Loft & Roof Plans, 101 004 Front & Side Elevations, 101 005 Rear Elevation & Sections CC & DD, 101 006 Section AA, 101 007 Section BB
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the Publication London Plan (2020), Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012).
| The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To minimise light spillage and interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| The (south) side facing windows to the outrigger roof extension shall be obscure glazed non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the room in which the window is installed.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the Publication London Plan (2020), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the Publication London Plan (2020), policies 7A, 7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).
